testcase.name: ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > generates initial ledger state deterministically
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > approves a Tier 1 loan and caps at the max amount
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > approves a Tier 2 loan and gives the requested amount
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > proposes a Tier 3 loan when amount exceeds limit
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > rejects a loan for a non-eligible applicant
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > creates multiple loans for the same user with incrementing IDs
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws an error if the user is blacklisted
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > allows admin to blacklist and remove a user
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > migrates a small number of loans (1 batch) and cleans up
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > migrates multiple batches of loans (7 loans) correctly
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws an error if user tries to requestLoan during migration
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > migrates loans to a new PIN that already has loans
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when requesting loan with zero amount
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when blacklisted user tries to change PIN
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when changing PIN to the same value
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > allows admin to transfer admin role to new admin
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > approves exactly at Tier 1 boundary when amount within limit (score=700, income=2000, tenure=24)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > proposes Tier 2 when just below Tier 1 threshold (score=699)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > proposes at Tier 2 boundary when amount exceeds limit (score=600, income=1500)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > proposes Tier 3 when just below Tier 2 threshold (score=599)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > proposes at Tier 3 boundary when amount exceeds limit (score=580)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > rejects when just below Tier 3 threshold (score=579)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > proposes Tier 2 when Tier 1 income requirement not met
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > proposes Tier 2 when Tier 1 tenure requirement not met
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when non-admin tries to blacklist a user
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when non-admin tries to remove from blacklist
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when non-admin tries to transfer admin
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > generates same public key for same user and PIN (determinism)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > generates different public key for same user with different PIN
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > generates different public key for different users with same PIN
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > blacklisting an already blacklisted user is idempotent
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > removing a non-blacklisted user from blacklist does not throw
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > same user with different PINs has separate loan records
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > blacklisting a different Zswap key does not affect the caller
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > new admin can perform admin operations after transfer
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > old admin cannot perform admin operations after transfer
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > can chain multiple admin transfers
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > creates Proposed loan when requested amount exceeds tier limit
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > creates Approved loan when requested amount is within tier limit
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > creates Approved loan when requested amount is less than tier limit
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > respondToLoan with accept=true changes Proposed to Approved
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > respondToLoan with accept=false changes Proposed to NotAccepted with zero amount
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when respondToLoan is called on non-Proposed loan
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when respondToLoan is called on already accepted loan
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when respondToLoan is called with non-existent loan ID
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when respondToLoan is called by user with no loans
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when blacklisted user tries to respondToLoan
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > creates Proposed loan for Tier 2 user exceeding limit
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > creates Proposed loan for Tier 3 user exceeding limit
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > rejected applicant still gets Rejected status (not Proposed)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > can have multiple Proposed loans and respond to each independently
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > rejects loan with invalid attestation signature
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > rejects loan with unregistered provider
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > rejects loan after provider is removed
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > user binding prevents replay (signature for user A cannot be used by user B)
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when non-admin tries to register provider
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when non-admin tries to remove provider
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > throws when removing a non-existent provider
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > multiple providers can both be used for attestation
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > provider registry shows up in ledger state
ZKLoanCreditScorer smart contract > attestation with tampered credit data fails signature verification
